perturbation.original_text: For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.changed_text: For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 90 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'NET 30 days' to 'NET 90 days' for payment of the lead-finder fee could be a violation of prompt payment laws, depending on the state and the specific industry. While Texas doesn't have a specific prompt payment law for all industries, extending payment terms significantly without clear justification can be viewed as an unfair business practice, especially if it puts undue financial strain on Bravatek. Some states have laws requiring payments within a reasonable time frame, and 90 days may be considered unreasonable in certain contexts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing and potential violation of state-specific prompt payment laws if applicable to the industry or considered an unreasonable delay.

perturbation.original_text:
6) Term of Confidentiality
 
For a period of five (5) years after termination of this Agreement, the parties shall treat as confidential all information and take every
reasonable precaution and use all reasonable efforts to prevent the unauthorized disclosure of the same. The parties agree to take all steps
reasonably necessary and appropriate to ensure that their employees, agents, and/or assistants treat all information as confidential and to
ensure that such employees, agents, and/or assistants are familiar with and abide by the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
6) Term of Confidentiality
 
For a period of one (1) year after termination of this Agreement, the parties shall treat as confidential all information and take every
reasonable precaution and use all reasonable efforts to prevent the unauthorized disclosure of the same. The parties agree to take all steps
reasonably necessary and appropriate to ensure that their employees, agents, and/or assistants treat all information as confidential and to
ensure that such employees, agents, and/or assistants are familiar with and abide by the terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the confidentiality period from five years to one year might be considered unreasonably short, especially concerning trade secrets or sensitive business information. Texas law, particularly regarding trade secrets, often assumes a longer period is necessary for protection. A one-year term could be deemed insufficient to prevent misappropriation and competitive harm, especially if the information has a longer lifespan of economic value. This could contradict reasonable expectations for confidentiality and trade secret protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially inadequate protection of trade secrets under Texas Uniform Trade Secrets Act (TUTSA) and common law principles related to confidentiality and non-disclosure agreements.
